descr: "Captures constraints on each element within the resource, profile, or extension."

fields.name: key
fields.descr: "Allows identification of which elements have their cardinalities impacted by the constraint.  Will not be referenced for constraints that do not affect cardinality."

fields.name: requirements
fields.descr: "Description of why this constraint is necessary or appropriate."

fields.name: severity
fields.descr: "Identifies the impact constraint violation has on the conformance of the instance."

fields.name: human
fields.descr: "Text that can be used to describe the constraint in messages identifying that the constraint has been violated."

fields.name: expression
fields.descr: "A [FHIRPath](http://hl7.org/fluentpath) expression of constraint that can be executed to see if this constraint is met."

fields.name: xpath
fields.descr: "An XPath expression of constraint that can be executed to see if this constraint is met."

fields.name: source
fields.descr: "A reference to the original source of the constraint, for traceability purposes."

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces."
 derived from Element
 derived from BackboneElement

fields.name: _id
fields.descr:
"Extensions for id"
 derived from Element
 derived from BackboneElement

In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions.
